required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on May 29, 2018
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.official_title: A Randomised, Double-Blind, Placebo-Controlled, Parallel-Group Efficacy and Safety Comparison of One-Year Treatment of Two Doses (5mg and 10mg) of Tiotropium Inhalation Solution Delivered by the Respimat Device in Patients With Chronic Obstructive Pulmonary Disease (COPD)

brief_summary.textblock: To evaluate the long term effects of treatment with two doses of Tiotropium delivered by the Respimat inhaler in patients with COPD.

primary_outcome.measure: Change From Baseline in Trough FEV1 After 48 Weeks
primary_outcome.time_frame: 10 minutes prior to test-drug inhalation and at 5, 30 and 60 minutes and 2 and 3 hours after inhalation of study medication
primary_outcome.description: Change From Baseline in Trough Forced Expiratory Volume in 1 second (FEV1) after 48 weeks

primary_outcome.measure: Saint George's Respiratory Questionnaire (SGRQ) Total Score, Full Analysis Set - Saint George's Respiratory Questionnaire (FAS-QOL)
primary_outcome.description: Rating scale of 3 domains - symptoms, activities and impact (weighted). Worst score = 100, best score = 0

primary_outcome.measure: TDI Focal Score, Full Analysis Set - Transitional Dyspnoea Index (FAS-TDI) (Combined Studies)
primary_outcome.description: Rating scale of 3 components - change in functional impairment, change in magnitude of tasks, change in magnitude of efforts. Worst score = -9, best score = +9 For this endpoint data of twin studies NCT00168844 and NCT00168831 was combined.

primary_outcome.measure: COPD Exacerbation Rate, Safety Set (SS) (Combined Studies)
primary_outcome.description: Number of Chronic Obstructive Pulmonary Disease (COPD) exacerbations per patient year For this endpoint data of the twin studies NCT00168844 and NCT00168831 was combined.

secondary_outcome.measure: Change From Baseline in Trough FEV1 After 2, 8, 16, 24, 32 and 40 Weeks
secondary_outcome.time_frame: 10 minutes prior to test-drug inhalation and at 5, 30 and 60 minutes and 2 and 3 hours after inhalation of study medication
secondary_outcome.description: Change From Baseline in Trough Forced Expiratory Volume in 1 second (FEV1) after 2, 8, 16, 24, 32 and 40 weeks. The means are adjusted for centre, smoking status at entry and baseline value.

secondary_outcome.measure: Change From Baseline in Trough FVC After 2, 8, 16, 24, 32, 40 and 48 Weeks
secondary_outcome.time_frame: 10 minutes prior to test-drug inhalation and at 5, 30 and 60 minutes and 2 and 3 hours after inhalation of study medication
secondary_outcome.description: Change From Baseline in Trough Forced vital capacity (FVC) after 2, 8, 16, 24, 32, 40 and 48 weeks. The means are adjusted for centre, smoking status at entry and baseline value.

secondary_outcome.measure: Change From Baseline in FEV1 AUC0-3 After 2, 8, 16, 24, 32, 40 and 48 Weeks
secondary_outcome.time_frame: 10 minutes prior to test-drug inhalation and at 5, 30 and 60 minutes and 2 and 3 hours after inhalation of study medication
secondary_outcome.description: FEV1 AUC0-3 represents the Area under Curve over the time interval from 0 to 3 hours after 2, 8, 16, 24, 32, 40 and 48 weeks. The means are adjusted for centre, smoking status at entry and baseline value.

secondary_outcome.measure: Change From Baseline in FVC AUC0-3 After 2, 8, 16, 24, 32, 40 and 48 Weeks
secondary_outcome.time_frame: 10 minutes prior to test-drug inhalation and at 5, 30 and 60 minutes and 2 and 3 hours after inhalation of study medication
secondary_outcome.description: FVC AUC0-3 represents the Area under Curve over the time interval from 0 to 3 hours after 2, 8, 16, 24, 32, 40 and 48 weeks. The means are adjusted for centre, smoking status at entry and baseline value.

secondary_outcome.measure: Weekly Mean Morning Pre-dose PEFRs
secondary_outcome.description: Weekly mean morning pre-dose peak expiratory flow rates (PEFRs). The means are adjusted for centre, smoking status at entry, and baseline value.

secondary_outcome.measure: Weekly Mean Morning Evening PEFRs
secondary_outcome.description: Weekly mean evening peak expiratory flow rates (PEFRs). The means are adjusted for centre, smoking status at entry, and baseline value.

secondary_outcome.measure: Weekly Mean Number of Puffs of Rescue Medication Per Day
secondary_outcome.description: Weekly mean number of puffs of rescue medication used per day as required (PRN salbutamol). The means are adjusted for centre, smoking status at entry, and baseline value.

secondary_outcome.measure: Mahler TDI Scores
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Week 48
secondary_outcome.description: Mahler Transitional Dyspnoea Index (TDI) scores measured as change in functional impairment, change in magnitude of tasks and change in magnitude of efforts over the treatment period. The means are adjusted for centre, smoking status at entry and baseline value. Worst score = -3, best score = +3

secondary_outcome.measure: Saint George's Respiratory Questionnaire (SGRQ) Scores
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Week 48
secondary_outcome.description: Saint George's Respiratory Questionnaire (SGRQ) Scores impacts, activities and symptoms. Worst score = 100, best score = 0. The means are adjusted for centre, smoking status at entry and baseline value.

secondary_outcome.measure: COPD Symptoms Scores
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Week 48
secondary_outcome.description: COPD symptoms Scores - wheezing, shortness of breath, coughing and tightness of chest over the treatment period. Scale: 0 = None, 1 = Mild, 2 = Moderate, 3 = Severe The means are adjusted for centre, smoking status at entry and baseline value.

secondary_outcome.measure: PGE Scores
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Week 48
secondary_outcome.description: Physician's Global evaluation (PGE) scores over the treatment period. Scale: 1−2 = Poor, 3−4 = Fair, 5−6 = Good, 7−8 = Excellent The means are adjusted for centre, smoking status at entry and baseline value.

secondary_outcome.measure: PGR Scores
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Week 48
secondary_outcome.description: Patient's Global rating (PGR) scores over the treatment period. Scale: 1=much better to 7=much worse The means are adjusted for centre, smoking status at entry and baseline value.

criteria.textblock:
Criteria
- Patients with stable moderate to severe COPD and a smoking history of at least 10 pack years were eligible for inclusion in the study. Patients with significant diseases other than COPD were excluded as were patients with a recent history of myocardial infarction, history of malignancy, unstable or life-threatening cardiac arrhythmia, narrow-angle glaucoma, asthma or other allergic conditions. Patients treated with cromolyn, nedocromil, oral beta-adrenergics or unstable doses of oral corticosteroids were ineligible for inclusion in the study as were patients who had received previous treatment with tiotropium.

facility.name: Baumgartner Hohe Otto Wagner Spital Wien

outcome.title: COPD Exacerbation Rate, Safety Set (SS) (Combined Studies)
outcome.description: Number of Chronic Obstructive Pulmonary Disease (COPD) exacerbations per patient year For this endpoint data of the twin studies NCT00168844 and NCT00168831 was combined.
outcome.time_frame: 48 weeks
outcome.population: Safety Set. Combined analysis of studies NCT00168844 and NCT00168831. 670 patients analysed in total comprises 338 patients from NCT00168831 and 332 patients from study NCT00168844, 667 patients - 335 and 332, 653 patients - 334 and 319 respectively.

outcome.title: Change From Baseline in Trough FEV1 After 2, 8, 16, 24, 32 and 40 Weeks
outcome.description: Change From Baseline in Trough Forced Expiratory Volume in 1 second (FEV1) after 2, 8, 16, 24, 32 and 40 weeks. The means are adjusted for centre, smoking status at entry and baseline value.
outcome.time_frame: 10 minutes prior to test-drug inhalation and at 5, 30 and 60 minutes and 2 and 3 hours after inhalation of study medication

outcome.title: Change From Baseline in Trough FVC After 2, 8, 16, 24, 32, 40 and 48 Weeks
outcome.description: Change From Baseline in Trough Forced vital capacity (FVC) after 2, 8, 16, 24, 32, 40 and 48 weeks. The means are adjusted for centre, smoking status at entry and baseline value.

measure.title: Change From Baseline in Trough FVC After 2, 8, 16, 24, 32, 40 and 48 Weeks
measure.description: Change From Baseline in Trough Forced vital capacity (FVC) after 2, 8, 16, 24, 32, 40 and 48 weeks. The means are adjusted for centre, smoking status at entry and baseline value.

analysis.method_desc: ANCOVA analysis with terms for treatment, smoking status at entry, centre and baseline value.

outcome.title: Change From Baseline in FEV1 AUC0-3 After 2, 8, 16, 24, 32, 40 and 48 Weeks
outcome.description: FEV1 AUC0-3 represents the Area under Curve over the time interval from 0 to 3 hours after 2, 8, 16, 24, 32, 40 and 48 weeks. The means are adjusted for centre, smoking status at entry and baseline value.
outcome.time_frame: 10 minutes prior to test-drug inhalation and at 5, 30 and 60 minutes and 2 and 3 hours after inhalation of study medication

measure.description: FEV1 AUC0-3 represents the Area under Curve over the time interval from 0 to 3 hours after 2, 8, 16, 24, 32, 40 and 48 weeks. The means are adjusted for centre, smoking status at entry and baseline value.

analysis.method_desc: ANCOVA analysis with terms for treatment, smoking status at entry, centre and baseline value.

outcome.title: Mahler TDI Scores
outcome.description: Mahler Transitional Dyspnoea Index (TDI) scores measured as change in functional impairment, change in magnitude of tasks and change in magnitude of efforts over the treatment period. The means are adjusted for centre, smoking status at entry and baseline value. Worst score = -3, best score = +3
outcome.time_frame: Week 48
outcome.population: Full Analysis Set - Transitional Dyspnoea Index (FAS-TDI)

group.title: Tiotropium Respimat 5mcg

measure.title: Mahler TDI Scores
measure.description: Mahler Transitional Dyspnoea Index (TDI) scores measured as change in functional impairment, change in magnitude of tasks and change in magnitude of efforts over the treatment period. The means are adjusted for centre, smoking status at entry and baseline value. Worst score = -3, best score = +3
measure.population: Full Analysis Set - Transitional Dyspnoea Index (FAS-TDI)

outcome.title: Saint George's Respiratory Questionnaire (SGRQ) Scores
outcome.description: Saint George's Respiratory Questionnaire (SGRQ) Scores impacts, activities and symptoms. Worst score = 100, best score = 0. The means are adjusted for centre, smoking status at entry and baseline value.
outcome.time_frame: Week 48
outcome.population: Full Analysis Set - Saint George's Respiratory Questionnaire (FAS-QOL)
